descriptionSet.description: The four-armed goddess Sarasvati is depicted playing Sitar while sitting on a big rock next to a river. She is holding a Mala and a package of soap in here free hands. A peacock is standing on a rock on the left. Behind her there is a big bush with some red berries.

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

rights.text: Copyrighted. Copyright with the original artists and publishers.

hra:item.hra:value: text-en: Vinolia Co. Ltd. LONDON, ENGLAND.

description-en: The four-armed goddess Sarasvati is depicted playing Sitar while sitting on a big rock next to a river. She is holding a Mala and a package of soap in here free hands. A peacock is standing on a rock on the left. Behind her there is a big bush with some red berries. (gs)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Like other products, these advertisements on calendars invoked devotional and mythological imagery to sell soap. Gods and goddesses were their first models. (Sabeena Gadihoke)(gs)
explanatory comments/crosstagging: The connection between Hindu Gods and soap through the motiv of pureness is more than obvious. (gs)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: This calendar was based on a well-known Raja Ravi Varma paintings. Scholars have point outed that many "pirate" versions of his images would circulate repetitively in calendars over time. (Sabeena Gadihoke)(gs)
related literature: Dyer, Richard and Christine Gledhill 2009. "Wanted: Cultured ladies Only! Female Stardom and Cinema in India 1930s-1950s". Urbana and Chicago: University of Illinois Press. (gs)

related literature: Jain, Kajri 2007. "Gods in the Bazaar: The Economies of Indian Calendar Art". Durham NC: Duke University Press. (gs)
related literature: McClintock, Anne 2001. “Soft Soaping Empire: Commodity Racism and Imperial Advertising” in Double Crossings: Madness, Sexuality and Imperialism. Vancouver, Canada: Ronsdale. (gs)
related literature: Sivulka, Julianne 1998. "Soap, Sex and Cigarettes: A Cultural History of Advertising". Belmont, California: Wadsworth Publishing Co. (gs)
